snippet: An archaeological dig in London has unearthed remains of the Curtain Theater, which was home to the Lord Chamberlain's Men from 1597 to 1599 and was the site where plays including "Romeo and Juliet" and possibly "Henry V" were first performed.
abstract: An archaeological dig in London has unearthed remains of the Curtain Theater, which was home to the Lord Chamberlain's Men from 1597 to 1599 and was the site where plays including "Romeo and Juliet" and possibly "Henry V" were first performed.

headline.main: Early Theater of Shakespeare Is Unearthed in London
headline.print_headline: Early Theater of Shakespeare Is Unearthed in London
